text:
Hello! This is Chef John from
FoodWishes.com with:

How to Eat a Chicken Wing!
And I'm not talking about

the little drum-met part, anyone can eat
one of those. I'm talking about the flat.

People gnaw around those 2 bones,
it drives me insane, that's not how you

eat a chicken wing.
You can't get all the meat off.
Look at that: horrible.

Alright, here's how you do it. Pick up
your flat part of the chicken wing,

and find the end of that has the
bigger protrusion of bones.
See, you can see it better there.

That's kind of the skinnier end, there's
a bigger end, there's little piece of

cartilage there at the end,
you can pull that off, I eat it.
And then find the little bone.

There's 2 bones, one's skinny,
and one's a little fatter.

Alright, find the skinny bone,
give a little wiggle and twist,
and that will pull right out clean.

This only works, by the way, if the
chicken wings are cooked properly.
and cooked enough.

Alright, so once you've pulled the
small wing bone out, pull the skinny

end tight, and grab the bigger bone,
there, and just twist that until it

releases, and pull that up slowly,
if any meat comes out with it,
just you know,
suck it off the bone.
And there you go.

A perfectly boned chicken wing flat,
100 percent meat, there is a tiny bit of

cartilage at the end that is very
delicious and edible, so I eat it.

You can pull it off if you want.
You dip it, you eat it, it's fantastic.

By the way, these were pastrami chicken
wings, a new invention, so you'll see that

video soon, that's Russian dressing.
Anyway, that's how to eat a chicken wing.

Hope you enjoyed that, go to the site,
there's no ingredients, go there anyway.

And the best thing about eating chicken
wings alone, you can double dip. Enjoy!
